title: Is it bad for a 5-minute YouTube video to take 12-24 hours from writing script, to recording and editing, to upload? - Quora

response.answer_text: OPOQ: Is it bad for a 5-minute YouTube video to take 12-24 hours from writing script, to recording and editing, to upload? If the end result is bad, then it is bad. And vice-versa! Time taken to do an edit, write, shoot, et.does not necessarily equate to quality. I have directed, shot and edited interviews and had them on air in a matter of half an hour or so. It happens in news all the time. I have, written shot and edited TVCs within a few hours and had them on air the same evening. Possibly they weren’t great works of art but they did the job. I have also done the same where the editing alone for a 45 second TVC took three weeks and about 10 recuts and pack changes, firing of the VO artist and a client who changed his mind whenever he came into the suite. It happens! It’s easier on You Tube because you don’t have to meet broadcast standards.—or any standards as far as I can tell , and you probably don’t have clients, And of course it could be a single shot 5 of minutes with a VO read by a good VO artist, needing no real editing excerpt black on either end, On You Tube in a couple of hours. The main thing is the content and the execution - the time taken is not relevant.

Well that depends on the video, and why you consider that time frame bad. For example, a typical Kurzgesagt video takes approximately 1200 hours of labour to create. That’s around a 100 solid working days, and in actuality that works out to about 2–3 designers and 2–3 animators plus a team of others working for many weeks, sometimes more than a year to create a single video.  So are you suggest that you’re not creating content fast enough, or is it that you’re not putting enough time and effort into the content? ;) Its all relative.
